content.new:

content.old:
I'm running Ubuntu 12.04 through a Virtual Box VM and noticed that when trying to run the example use of pepxml.read() shown here (http://pythonhosted.org/pyteomics/data.html), the following error resulted:

File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages

message.raw:
Hi Brian,

thank you for reporting! This is definitely a bug; we just hadn't come across a file that would show it until now. I'll add a fix for this as soon as possible, probably something similar to what you are showing above (but preserving the value). 

**Edit:** What I'm thinking of is the following:

```
#!python

try:
    scores[name] = float(value)
except ValueError:
    scores[name] = value
```

P.S. I'm wondering why the line number is 90 in the traceback you are showing, because it's line 85 in all recent versions of pyteomics. Is it an older version, or have you added other changes? Just curious :)

Thanks again,

Lev
message.html:
Hi Brian,

thank you for reporting! This is definitely a bug; we just hadn't come across a file that would show it until now. I'll add a fix for this as soon as possible, probably something similar to what you are showing above (but preserving the value).

Edit: What I'm thinking of is the following:

try:
    scores[name] = float(value)
except ValueError:
    scores[name] = value

P.S. I'm wondering why the line number is 90 in the traceback you are showing, because it's line 85 in all recent versions of pyteomics. Is it an older version, or have you added other changes? Just curious :)

Thanks again,

Lev

message.raw:
The proposed patch is implemented in commit 12050d4. I'll wait for some time before marking this as fixed.

P.S. Also, if you think the custom changes you've made to the sources may be of use to others, I'll be happy to review your pull request. Or maybe an enhancement request for additional configuration options?

Anyway, thanks for all your help so far.

Lev
message.html:

message.raw: Marking as fixed; feel free to comment or report a new issue if any problems arise.
